section.title: Syntax and semantics
section.para: Syntax of the process instructions is given by the following grammar :
section.programlisting:
inputPI -> (captures | content | end)
captures -> (label ':')? capture (',' capture)*
capture -> dataID '=' expression
dataID -> Ident
content -> expression
end -> END labels?
labels -> label (',' label)*
label -> Ident
END -> [Ee][nN][Dd]
section.para: A process instruction, processed by the software could be either :

listitem.para: a series of data source capture definition (: 'captures' rule)
a content to insert given by an expression (: 'content' rule)
the end of series of definition and expansion (: 'end' rule)

section.title: captures (: 'captures' rule)
section.para: Captures are expressions related to references, retrieving data from data sources directly or indirectly from other captures.
They can preceded by a label to identify the series when closing their scope.
It opens a related expansive xml block's series.
Expressions of a same series should have a same cardinality at the same time.

section.title: content (: 'content' rule)
section.para: Content is an expression whom results are inserted at this point and consequently trigger xml output's expansion.

section.title: end of expansive blocks (: 'end' rule)
section.para: This instruction closes expansive xml blocks and related data definitions of a same xml level.
If no label is given, it closes the last captures series, defined.
If labels are given, it closes all between labeled captures series, quoted.

section.title: expression (: 'expression' rule)
section.para: Expression is an Acceleo Query Language expression.
